definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
to nibble away at sth/to eat into/to erode

sentences.english: Development of the landscape around the sea, beautiful scenery, is one of the well - known scenic spot .
sentences.chinese: 周围海蚀地貌发育，景色绮丽，是著名的风景区之一。

sentences.english: Cliff Park is composed mainly of the Lishunong Ocean Trench, which is formed due to marine-abrasion.
sentences.chinese: 峭壁公园以里柱弄海沟为主体，因海蚀作用而形成。

sentences.english: And this is typical marine- abrasion topography.
sentences.chinese: 这里就是典型的海蚀地貌了。

sentences.english: Shek O sea cavern, its rock faces glistening with seeping groundwater.
sentences.chinese: 石澳的海蚀洞地下水渗润，岩壁闪闪发亮。

sentences.english: The Eweishan Magic Stone Park looks resplendent due to its marine-abrasion topography.
sentences.chinese: 鹅尾神石园独特的海蚀地貌，色彩斑斓令人称奇。

sentences.english: Should be considered marine- abrasion topography, right?
sentences.chinese: 应该是一种海蚀地貌吧？

sentences.english: The transgression is very serious here.
sentences.chinese: 这里的海蚀现象很严重。

definition: rhyolite (extrusive igneous rock, chemically equivalent to granite)
karst landform (weathered limestone, often forming caves)
